subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Dalai Lama and Neuroscience
description: A quick win: understand The Dalai Lama and Neuroscience.

hook.text: The Dalai Lama invites scientists to test Buddhist meditation. If science disproves a belief, Buddhism must change.

buildup.text: Since the 1980s, the Dalai Lama has collaborated with neuroscientists through the Mind and Life Institute.

discovery.text: Brain scans of monks show meditation produces lasting changes in brain structure. Compassion is trainable, not innate.

twist.text: His openness to science is rare among religious leaders. Most traditions resist testing their claims empirically.

climax.text: Buddhism's willingness to change based on evidence is a model for all religions engaging science. Humility is the key.

punchline.text: If science disproves it, change the belief. The Dalai Lama leads by example.

quiz.question: How does the Dalai Lama approach science?
options: He collaborates with scientists and accepts evidence over belief
